website_summaries.verdict: This sleek calculator handles all sorts of complex equations.  Updated with a rugged metallic body for added durability.
pros: This model excels at both basic math and advanced financial functions
Special "worksheet mode" allows users to perform complex calculations regarding depreciation, interest, amortization, and more
cons: Some owners have reported that buttons can be unresponsive

customer_reviews.title: Needed for classes, but not a great product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is "required" to have this particular calculator by her finance profs and will need it for future financial exams. But seriously? We sent the first one back because of a crappy screen that decorates itself with lcd lines with the slightest pressure. Heck, the screen looked broken. Second one did the same thing. We'd go with HP is she could use THAT one on her tests. Apparently this is a common complaint for this item. Read the two star reviews. We'd send the second back too if my daughter didn't HAVE to have this brand. Geez. These people are making a very crappy thing for figuring out formulas that are so important.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel_Chaser

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the premium cost
customer_reviews.text: Calculator works as it should. But considering the price it isn't well made. The buttons are hard to press and the screen brings artifacts even when only gently wiping it. Calculator can't even display fractions like my $15 Cisco. The protection sleeve is no longer made out of soft vinyl like older versions but very thin non protective material. Sorry I usually love Texas Instrument devices but this product is just subpar.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, on the bottom end, sadly
customer_reviews.text: The "great" news part: it did do the calculation The not-so-great news: the on/off button nearly die right before the exam day. I can't understand why they made the most important button so vulnerable. The absolutly-not-great news: the screen is a touch screen and very sensitive, as you can see in the picture. Why don't they consider to declair it as a feature ? The devil-news: the main circus board is permanently stuck on the front cover and you will not be able to fix any button... Super brilliant design. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Linh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Stale low-quality past-century device
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn't necessary for the CFA test, i would return it the next day. This thing is actually able to bring you test score down. But what can we do? There is nothing better allowed on the test, i guess. I wish CFA Institute took note of the poor quality of this hardware and introduced something more decent. This calculator consistently misses numbers, especially when i type with two hands. Buttons are hard to press. After 2.5 months of use, #9 is barely responsive, have to press it several times to get it displayed. I used Citizen scientific calculators before signing up for CFA, they are way higher quality and easier to use. Shame on TI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you peck at the numbers hard with one hand you should be fine. But if you expect to use this like ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid Calculator, currently using it for an accounting course have used it for some statistics work and economics calculations. Biggest complaint about this calculator is that you cant type fast without missing numbers, if you try to press two numbers on the same room quickly, one of them wont show up. If you peck at the numbers hard with one hand you should be fine. But if you expect to use this like any other calculator and type with both thumbs quickly, you'll end up doing your equations two or three times before you actually get every number typed in properly.
customer_reviews.author: yeareynolds

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: This device is cheap compared to the money paid. TI should be ashamed for selling such low quality products. For starters, the screen "bleeds" black streaks if you touch it. The bleeding eventually goes away when the calculator is in use but it comes back next time you power it on and touch the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Philico

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality build and materials, great calculator
customer_reviews.text: The calculator itself functions well, but as a student, I carry this in my backpack and every time I gently wipe smudges or dust from the screen, it shows hairline fractures. It came this way new in the package which is absolute garbage. This calculator is far too fragile. It's portable for a reason, otherwise, I'd just use excel for everything, so this thing needs to be WAY more durable than it is.
customer_reviews.author: ckill3

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible POS
customer_reviews.text: The decimal broke 1 month and 10 days after using it. I tried resetting it, tried new batteries, tried various troubleshooting. Nope. Just a broken decimal key that won't register. How the hell is a financial calculator anymore more than an expensive ineffective paperweight when it doesn't have a decimal key? Oh and this is after 30 days so no refund and terrible customer service. Avoid. Avoid. AVOIDDDD!
customer_reviews.author: Boaty McBoatFace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the CFA Exam.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this model for the CFA Exam, I picked this model over the BA II Plus because of its ability to calculate payback period and discount payback period, although this is a simple calculation, it saves time during the exam and it leaves less margin for user error. Also, it's a little better build quality than its counterpart. My only complaint is that you have to be very intentional with your keystrokes, you have to make sure you've fully depressed the key. However, you could argue that this helps prevent miss keying something. All in all it's a great financial calculator that's easy to learn and use. I'd highly recommend it, especially for college, MBA, and CFA.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wright II

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I have the TI-84 Plus CE graphing calculator but since I am taking my degree in accounting I decided to purchase the BA II Plus Pro. The digits are very hard to press and no backlight?! Seriously?! For that price, you would expect to have at least backlight. Now when I study on my laptop and need to use the calculator if I don't have an overhead bright lamp on, I can't see anything!! Very disappointed, it looks like a cheap Dollar Store calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Perkonx

customer_reviews.title: Great for upper level finance and accounting courses
customer_reviews.text: Great calculator for upper level finance and accounting courses. The screen is sensitive to imprints but they are temporary. I mainly keep this on my desk and it has little rubber pads on the bottom which keeps it in place when inputing on the calculator. This one looks sleek and professional compared with the non-professional model and the batteries do not require a tool to replace. Bond calculations are quick and easy on this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: - Because I need a spare calculator for CFA exam - Battery is easily replaceable - It looks
customer_reviews.text: After receiving it, I'm dissapointed. - The screen shows lines on it even on the touch which bothers me if this is happening on day 1 - Keys are very slightly harder to press than the BA II Plus - Leather case was thrown out because it barely fits Why I'm keeping it? - Because I need a spare calculator for CFA exam - Battery is easily replaceable - It looks sleek
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Bad but required
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for class but compared to a regular calculator at cheaper prices this is missing a lot of useful features. For example, if you are writing an equation with parenthesis and exponents, it does not show what you've done so far. It just blinks with the inputs. It does not show parenthesis or a line of previous inputs. That's incredibly bad for a fancy calculator at this price.
customer_reviews.author: roheel131

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive Screen
customer_reviews.text: It's a calculator and does what I need it to do, but I expected better quality. I should have listened to the other reviews that mentioned the sensitive screen. When I opened it, I thought the screen was broken (see picture). Overall disappointed, but I need it for school so it'll have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Pain to use, but it's sleek and great for calculating annuities
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the 5 key doesn't always recognize when I press it, and a friend had the same issue. I can't see previous calculations, so the recall function gets used a lot. If you don't need to calculate annuities or present values, then I wouldn't recommend this since there are other calculators that are cheaper where you can view your calculation history.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Best financial gadget out there
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for a graduate finance class and have been using it as a trusted financial tool ever since. There is a bit of a learning curve associated with learning the functions, but spending some time with online tutorials or with the handy informational card that comes with the calculator can easily overcome that hurdle. The case it comes with adds a bit of a prestige feel to the calculator, too. Despite living in an era of apps and cloud-computing, it is still hard to beat the utility and practicality of the TI BA II Plus. I plan on using this tool for life.
customer_reviews.author: Elza Wiatt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Trust Youtube Videos, Do Reset before first use
customer_reviews.text: Good. However the support documentation isnt enough. Trust the youtube videos for more clarity on some of the functions. Would suggest you first press the reset before you start using..... because all time value calculations were going wrong with the factory setting.
customer_reviews.author: YE Siva

customer_reviews.title: I am very disapointed about the new version of the calculator
customer_reviews.text: the old version has a leather case, and the quality of the screen is much better than the new version, the new version looks like a cheap toy. I would not buy it if it is required for CFA exam. The old version is really good though, but I sold it, I am so regret.
customer_reviews.author: Chao

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive Screen
customer_reviews.text: This calculator was delivered today. Upon opening the screen looked like many of the pictures of other reviews with many random lines and such. I set the calculator down for a good 15 minutes and the lines went away. I’m now afraid to let anything touch the screen. I don’t think a $50 calculator should have an issue like this. If the lines didn’t go away, I was going to return the product for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Williams

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Calculator
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the positive things people have said about the new design. I do love it, but with the entire exterior was metal. Only the button surface it metal, and the rest is heavy duty plastic. The case it comes with really sucks, it's just a "leather" pouch. Otherwise, i'm so happy with my purchase. Such a nice calculator. I want to play with it 24/7 and buy another, too bad I only need one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Great for school, but not the best for real world.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for my course, but there are many similar apps available on your smart phone for a few bucks that work better in real life applications. The problem is that everything is hidden behind a long list of buttons you have to push in the exact order or you will get the wrong answers, its simply not user friendly and not intuitive at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed......
customer_reviews.text: I was eager for this product and now it's arrived I am so disappointed. See my video... the composite behind the outer screen appears broken.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Financial Mathematics Use full calculator for SOA
customer_reviews.text: I used this product while writing my Financial Mathematics SOA exam. I highly recommend this product because you can calculate duration problem from this calculator but this function is not available on BA II Plus. Please this calculator is difficult to use but you need a lot of practice required. I recommend you to practice using calculator rang than using formula in the paper which saves a lot of time. I solved 8 problems without writing single words in the paper during the exam period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Calculator for Supply Chain Management studies.
customer_reviews.text: For Finance, Advanced Supply Chain, and other classes in this discipline this is the calculator to have. I could not have gotten through many of those upper level math classes without this calculator. You need those functions to be able to handle Business Calculus, and a few other classes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brett S

customer_reviews.title: If you plan on being a finance major, this guy will be your bestfriend
customer_reviews.text: Graphing calculators are banned in high level business courses at my university because people can "cheat" on exams. + So I ordered one of these from amazon.com and it came quick and worked out really well. I got the silver one pictured and couldn't be happier. + It does take some getting used to so I'd check out the manual, the silver one comes with a nice thick traditional TI booklet/manual. - The only downside about this calculator is that it takes some time to get used to the button configurations and layout * Overall I can't find anything wrong with this product and my only negative was being super nit-picky because I loved my graphing calculator a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Atom Herr

customer_reviews.title: Defective Power Button
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this product included batteries, and that it seems to be a decent quality product- other than the one issue I had. The power/ on-off button is mashed down into the calculator and doesn't work properly. So I have to use tweezers or pliers to pull the on/off button out of the calculator to use it. Not thrilled with this issue since this calculator is supposed to be high quality product for over 50 dollars. Next time I will buy from a different seller or just to a physical location to buy the product.
customer_reviews.author: Presley B.

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I am spoiled by my old TI-82, but the quality of this calculator is not what I expected for $40. The buttons are frequently unresponsive, causing missed number entries and calculation errors. I am constantly retyping entries, which is frustrating and distracting. The results are accurate, but figuring out how to run present value, bond, and cash flow calculations can be a bit annoying. The input is not really all that intuitive for this technically inclined MBA student, although my problems may be caused by lack of experience in finance. Other students are using the HP equivalent and like it. I would try other options before choosing this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: A Must Buy in the Financial Field
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is one of my favorites. There is definitely a learning curve if you aren't accustomed to more advanced calculators. However, it is a must if you are intending to do any financial calculations referring to cash flows, annuities, bonds, etc... I'm an Actuarial Science major and this calculator has become my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb S.

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the average user. Would not recommend for the CFA exam. Keys aren't responsive at all. I recommend the HP12C, it's very responsive, and the RPN will help you speed up calculations on the exam. This calculator is good for school and looks cool, that's about it. HP12C wins.
customer_reviews.author: The Blank

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and functional calculator
customer_reviews.text: Great Calculator! As a non-science/math major student, this calculator is a good option for my statistic and pre-cal class. It’s lightweight, no worries to be a burden for your bag pack. Also, the panel shows graphs and equations simultaneously, way more easier for people like me who has trouble drawing perfect graph. In total, this calculator is user-friendly and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a counterfeit calculatoe
customer_reviews.text: The reason why people complain about the keys and the quality of this calculator is because it is straight up fake. I have no evidence it is actually fake to be fair. But it definitely feels way cheaper compared to what my classmates have (after purchased in the us) and everything is just different compared to the ones you get here. From the packaging to the actual calculator. Safe yourself some trouble and get yourself a real version of this calculator at a store. Otherwise you know what to expect.
customer_reviews.author: noumenon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for College Finance Course
customer_reviews.text: I needed a financial calculator for my college finance course, and I chose the Professional version because I find the silver face and buttons to be quite attractive. It is a very nice calculator indeed, but I have two minor complaints: 1) The keys have very little travel, so you sometimes have to press down on them harder to get a response. 2) It doesn't have a cover like many other calculators (I think the regular edition of this one even has one), so I worry about it getting turned on an wasting battery power in my backpack. Would definitely recommend it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Tsukiakari

customer_reviews.title: Better than the last version, but still not a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over prior model but still some gripes. For one, it does not have rubber pads on the bottom of the back side and thus it slides. I bought some rubber pads from TI's website for a few dollars and that did the trick. Not sure how that engineering flaw made it into the final product as the prior model did not have this issue. The fabric case is still poor quality, but at least they colored the interior of it black as opposed to the prior version which was a white and black mess.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for its purpose
customer_reviews.text: The TI BA II Plus Pro is a great calculator for financial analysis. I bought it for the CFA exams but use it for personal investment calculations and at work all the time. The buttons aren't very responsive if consecutive buttons are pressed too quickly, which detracted from the overall rating for me. Price wise it's fair but if you're looking for a financial calculator hopefully it will pay for itself quickly in time saved. Excel is a great tool but not always the most efficient. The "Case" is a simple leather sleeve. With an off button you don't need much protection anyway and the look is simple and sleek. Happy hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: it looks like the liquid inside the display has shifted around from ...
customer_reviews.text: got this for my finance class. I just really really really wish that it came with a hard case instead of a leatherette case. Upon opening it the first time, it looks like the liquid inside the display has shifted around from pressure. This actually happens all the time, I keep the calculator in a pen bag at the top of my backpack. Every time you take it out, its easy to see the pressure on the display. It does always go back to normal though; but its always scary upon first glance.
customer_reviews.author: vthreee

customer_reviews.title: Helped me pass CFA level 1 & 2
customer_reviews.text: Battery is still going strong, will use it for level 3 in June. Do look online for additional formulas as there are some hidden ones that are quite useful
customer_reviews.author: Ben G.

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator, horrible keys
customer_reviews.text: I love the BAII+. I am a finance professor and use it in class regularly. I got the professional because I didn't like the construction quality of the base model. Let me say: This thing is miserable to use. The buttons are very hard to press. I have to watch each button press carefully and check to make sure it registered (having used this calculator for over a decade, it is very embarrassing to make mistakes in front of 60 students). It is so bad, I use it as my calculator of last resort. I use the base model, then the one on my phone, and only if both are unavailable do I use the professional.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great financial calculator for finance or accounting
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is perfect for my accounting courses and career in accounting. It has all the functionalities of the BA II Plus with a few extra functionalities including the calculation of: Net Future Value (NFV), Modified Internal Rate of Return (MIRR), Modified Duration, Payback, and Discount Payback. There are two other general differences from the BA II Plus. 1. The buttons are smaller and feel firmer to press. 2. The order in which you plug in certain keys to calculate various functions are different from the BA II Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Shopperess

customer_reviews.title: More functions than the student version
customer_reviews.text: This calculator has additional functions when compared to the student version. It is making my life in my Finance courses a lot easier than the people that bought the student one. The leather case is a nice little extra, and it looks nicer in person than in the picture on amazon. It's all shiny... The buttons are stiff to press, so it takes a week to get used to them. Before I got used to the stiff buttons, I was leaving out numbers from my calculations, but now everything is fine. Honestly, this calculator is really nice, I will probably keep it well after I graduate.
customer_reviews.author: Newspeak

customer_reviews.title: Awful calculator. It ruined one of my Master's Degree exams.
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is awful. In addition to the critics about how hard is to press the buttons, this calculator is sometimes unable to compute IRR and NPV with around 12 cash flows and it shows "error" in the screen. I sadly found out this in the middle of one of my final exams and it ruined it. I strongly recommend to get the cheaper version of the BA II: the touch is considerably smoother, is way cheaper and it won't give you headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ignacio

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to hit buttons
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator because my upper division accounting courses required a financial calculator rather than a graphing, infact grpahing calculators were not allowed on tests. So since I am going into the accounting profession I figured I'd buy a quality calculator to last me into my career. I love the look of it, very sleek and professional however the buttons are slow to register. What I mean is if I am try to do a quick calculation, and I am punching in numbers rapidly a few would not get recognized despite it being fully pressed down. Very aggrivating when you are trying to compute simple calculations quickly.
customer_reviews.author: D Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Efficient, and Comfy to use Business Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Ease of Use = Excellent. DUAL FUNCTION KEYS are clearly marked, and easy to use. Color is used well. HANDBOOK which comes with the TI BA II Plus makes it easy to perform complex functions. Complex functions appear to be expanded, and extremely valuable, including clearer operations for "Time Value of Money", and labeling for it. The DUAL KEYS identifications are labeled much better and clearer; differentiating colors are used much better, an improvement over the TI BA I purchased about 14 years ago. I am very pleased with the functions of the TI BA II Plus business calculator, and even more pleased with the PRICE I paid on [...] for it!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Zvolanek

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me
customer_reviews.text: I read online that this calculator is best suited for the kind of exams I am interested in. Ex, FRM, CFA. Indeed, its serve its purpose well. It has a lot of functions which are quite handy in these exams. The only thing I didn't like about this is the keys are a bit too firm for me and I've to really be mindful when pressing them so as to register a button press. Overall its a good product. I wish it was a bit cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Shivam Sahni

customer_reviews.title: The features are good, but the product is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This calculator feels cheaper than my old $12 one. If it wasn’t for my university requiring this calculator, I’d send it back in a heartbeat. The screen wants to break from even slightly touching it!!! That’s totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Product made of cheap materials.
customer_reviews.text: Warning: Be careful wiping the screen calculator, it started displaying zigzagging lines, I thought would never go away. Relieved it was temporary. It never came with any cover or bag, but I read they are useless. I bought this for a finance class and will soon find out if all functions work. For now, I'll treat it as fragile as possible.
customer_reviews.author: RMA

customer_reviews.title: Just pay the extra few dollars and get the best calculator that is allowed on the Actuarial/Finance Exams
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is 100% worth it, I got a 4.0 in my Finance Class and in my Theory of Mathematical Interest class because it makes the work so much easier! This calculator does a lot of things its counter part, the regular BA II Plus, cannot do. Just pay the extra few dollars and get the best calculator that is allowed on the Actuarial/Finance Exams. etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive To Use - Great Financial Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to learn how to use this calculator. I later ordered an HP-12C, and I'm still trying to figure out how to do basic financial calculations a month later. The BA-II Professional is very easy to learn and is a quality product. I highly recommend it, especially if it is your first time using a financial calculator. I aced my Intro to Finance class with it; everyone else rushed out to buy HP-12C platinum's and had an extremely hard time with the class. The results speak for itself!
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for percentages
customer_reviews.text: I have had this calculator in the basic black version and when I saw it with the chrome bling accent I wanted it. This calculator is great for computing math involving money especially involving percentages! The calculator will display the difference before it is added to the final calculated answer. Answers are rounded off and precise, no more long number streams after the decimal point providing an answer that is to the point and eliminating the need for additional calculating.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator - manual confusing
customer_reviews.text: Great Calculator but the manual is confusing. They should include a DVD manual, it could then give more inclusive examples for all the possible functions of this calculator. I am using it to compute future value and bond valuation. It has so much more to offer, and I don't have the time to figure it all out thru trial and error. It has a nice feel and positive "hard key" punch is great ... do not like the soft key varieties, some keys are usually softer then others. And the rubber anti slide feet on the backside is also a nice feature. In conclusion - a very good calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Plantina

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: The product is defective, save your self from extra hassle & spend some 10 to 12 dollars extra to get a decent one. I have one fully functional same model yet just bought another one as a back up only to to find out the delivered device has defective screen. One of the fellow buyer in Amazon has got the same issue like me (with picture). Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: CFA MUST
customer_reviews.text: I am studying for the CFA Level 1 and I have to say its a MUST HAVE. The fuctions are really easy to use and learn. Comes with a booklet explaining everything you need to know. (Schweser does this as well) What i thought was really nice was the fact that this came with a really nice sleeve to put the calculator in while not in use. The calculator also has 4 rubber pads on the back which is great when using it on a desk. Overall i love it, great functions! Good Luck all CFA Candidates!
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality calculator, but no cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good calculator. The structure feels sturdy. The keys are not flimsy. However, it would be nice to have a cover. Without it, I can see the screen will get all scratch up very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would rather do the calculations by hand, since ...
customer_reviews.text: I would rather do the calculations by hand, since the buttons on this particular calculator tend to need a really firm push that is not conducive to typical business use. I need to know that pushing the button will actually enter the number. I have to nervously look at the readout after every single button I push because I don't know if the buttons are working.
customer_reviews.author: KenF

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator, Unbelievably Cheap Case
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is being used for a college degree program in accounting and has lived up to the needs of its user. Although it might not work as quickly as other models on the market, for this target market, it is great. Of course when you pay for this type of product at this price point, you would expect that it would automatically come with a case comparable to its value. The case offers little protection of any sort and so we discarded it and had to purchase something more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Lovin' It On Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This calculator came in handy in a pinch. Its best feature (besides that it comes up with correct calculations) is that the user manual makes it easy to use immediately. It's the friendliest user guide I've ever seen accompanying a calculator. It's a little annoying that it wants to display two decimal places always, but that's a setting you can change- however, when you reset input as you often have to do to start afresh with, for example, a new future value problem, it resets the whole thing back to double decimal places. But I can't live without it for accounting, overall. :)
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Screen/ Plastic case not metal.
customer_reviews.text: The slightest touch near the screen leaves arbitrary lines across the whole screen. Not a metal case but plastic. The worst calculator I have ever had, sent it back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: Plastic seal broken
customer_reviews.text: The plastic seal was broken in way looks like it was replaced with a used one, although I bought it new. More, I found little scratches on the surface of the calculator, which made me more confident that the calculator might have been replaced with a used one
customer_reviews.author: jarallah

customer_reviews.title: Good Financial Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is good for students who are studying Finance. If you are a Bachelor's/Master's student in Finance domain, then this calculator is good enough for you. But if you are planning to pursue your Phd in Finance then you might have to compare the features with other higher version product. Overall a good buy and it's working fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mohit Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option
customer_reviews.text: Buttons are hard. Wish I would have bought the student version instead. It does the exact same things and lower priced. This one is just plain okay but the buttons make it difficult to use
customer_reviews.author: Chach

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Well it's not that sophisticated and there are many multiple line display versions out there, nevertheless it's easy to use and precise. I take one star out because it's overpriced considering other brands. The manual included in the box is nicely detailed, it's kinda like a finance text book. Best of all; I really like the feedback of the buttons. I also got one Casio scientific calculator and I gotta say Texas Instruments' key pad feels much more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: John_N

customer_reviews.title: 99% Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Almost everything works as intended so it's a very good buy. Very useful. Its duration calculations are incorrect half the time though due to a known issue but that is the only thing I've found wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: thought i'd splurge on the Pro version - buttons are HORRIBLE. Never had any issues with the buttons on ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for CFA, thought i'd splurge on the Pro version - buttons are HORRIBLE. Never had any issues with the buttons on TI30, TI83, TI84+, really don't understand how this model made it through testing without TI fixing this. Not sure if the extra functionality is worth having to do every calculation 3 times to make sure your inputs registered. Have to slow down and press the buttons obnoxiously loudly and slowly to make sure the input registered.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: Texas Instruments has been working as expected! It is easy to use. I bought it as a gift to my cousin and she has found it very useful! There are more models out there so just make sure you get the one you want :)
customer_reviews.author: Thao

customer_reviews.title: Please do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: This product works I guess. The buttons are absolutely terrible, it doesn't come with a cover, and as far as I can tell has all the same functions as its non-professional equivalent. Huge waste of $10-$15 dollars for the upgrade to professional.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Jarmolowicz

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for a calculator, coming from an engineering student in a finance class. Got it because it’s one of four calculators allowed in our exams. Buttons are a little tricky to press but i don’t have any issues with it. Can’t complain really, it does what I need.
customer_reviews.author: MajickMike

customer_reviews.title: Best Calculator I Have Ever Used!
customer_reviews.text: First off, this is the easiest calculator to use! Has so many functions for the finance or real estate industry that I am in. I find the buttons easiest to press than any other calculator I have ever used. Very thin and easily portable. The only flaw is the soft case that it comes with, fits a bit too tight to the calculator making it harder to put in and take out. It justs takes time getting used to which I have now mastered. Have it now for a few days and I love it! Overall, I am very impressed with this calculator and I highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gianfranco

customer_reviews.title: It's a calculator, but it does wonders
customer_reviews.text: I sold my other BA II plus calculator to a friend because I decided I wanted to buy the professional version since it felt much better to use. I was going to give 4 stars because my calculator came without the little protective sleeve. But that was fixed with a quick call to Amazon's customer service. They got me into a different case no charge, which was fabulous. The calculator works great and will hopefully last me through all my actuarial exams to come.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Choi

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works perfectly. Not happy that it does not come with a front cover.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Great Financial Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for a class, but will use it forever.
customer_reviews.author: ECo1SG

customer_reviews.title: Has every function you need.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect calculator for UC college Finance class. Read all reviews first and it saved me the hassle/expense of not buying the right one.
customer_reviews.author: lessismore

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality construction
customer_reviews.text: The calculator is functional, but the quality is poor. It feels flimsy and too lightweight, the buttons are sometimes unresponsize and require uneven pressure to respond. In my case, the zero button failed entirely after only intermittent use. The protective sleeve it comes with is so thin that it's useless while also difficult to put on. The price is extremely high considering the low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A real find
customer_reviews.text: As a real estate broker, I use the calculator quite a bit to calculate various aspects of transactions. It is nice to have the best looking calculator in the conference room, but even better to have one that is easy to use and on which it is difficult to make mistakes. I don't get all the fuss about the "stiffness" of the buttons - it is not like you work up a sweat pushing them, and I appreciate 'knowing' when I have pressed it because I can feel it. This is a superb calculator and for TVM, business, and finance, it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Puck

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator after TI fixed
customer_reviews.text: Calculator was not computing bond values correctly. Instructor tried and it gave him the same incorrect answer. Called TI several times. FINALLY learned it needed to be reset. Lower back is a small hole. Push a pin in GENTLY and hold for a second then release. Classmate bot hers from Office Max,at a higher price, it had same problem. Did the reset and now no problems. Great calculator. Gave it 4 star because of the problem I had until TI told me how to resolve. Hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Svelte9

customer_reviews.title: A poor quality update from TI
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the black plastic version is grossly inferior to the previous silver aluminum version. In addition, the black plastic version is difficult to use, with clumsy, hard to press buttons. This is especially true if you have grown accustomed to using the silver version. Texas Instruments clearly sacrificed quality for higher profit margins, and they can get away with it considering the void of quality competitors. If possible, I recommend calling your local Staples to see if they still have the silver aluminum version in stock.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very good calculator. Had a friend recommend this calculator when ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good calculator. Had a friend recommend this calculator when I was taking a Finance class and it literally saved my life (and must importantly my grade!). theres a lot of tutorials on the internet that shows you how to find the answer for any finance, calculus, etc problem. If you are a accounting, finance, or math major this is definitely a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: sherry butler

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator, could use a better case
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the BA II Plus that was about 10 years old, this calculator is excellent. It has all the functions I need and feels nice when using it as well. The only downside is that it comes with a soft case. There's a "cheat sheet" card that comes with it that's very useful, but I find it difficult to put in the case with the calculator and don't feel the case really protects it. TI used to put a hard slide cover on their calculators and I wish they had done that with this one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Scarred for life
customer_reviews.text: Took a finance class because it was required for my major. This calculator was very useful, but if I never have to see it again, I would be thrilled. Good riddance. I hate finance. (The calculator worked well, though. 5 stars)
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Defective calculator, but works I guess.
customer_reviews.text: Someone in another review mentioned that the screen shows these weird lines if you put ANY pressure on it and my calculator had the same issue. Super confused about this product, have yet to really start using it so can’t comment on ease of use or any other features.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra bucks over BA II plus for better material
customer_reviews.text: Have not used extra pro features as compared to regular but sturdy construction is palpable. Buttons are harder to press which I think is matter of personal preference. Poor experience with regular BA II plus not lasting long enough to bring to exam
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super price, quality product
customer_reviews.text: I had a BA II and upgraded to do financial and estate planning calculations sans computer. Contrary to many reviews of the product, I liked the keyboard feel and didn't have any difficulty entering numbers. It has a solid feel and is easy to read. I did have to read the manual. You can't just grab the calculator and add and divide. This is set up as a financial calculator and must be setup for arithmetic. A great intermediate calculator that will keep you going when the computers are down.
customer_reviews.author: Di Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy this again
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the case that comes with it doesn't fit well. But a minor problem and would get this calculator again. Can compute most basic financial functions quickly. Need to refer to manual to get full advantage of the calculator 's capabilities
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: You have to buy it for financial
customer_reviews.text: Yes, my teacher force me to buy it, it really not look good but it's ture easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ming

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just too pricy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great as a financial calculator. There is a lot to learn to get all you can out of the calculator, but all the material can be searched and learned online. I wish it came with a harder case so that I did not have to worry about it breaking. There is a lower model that comes with a hard case that has the exact same button locations and functionality, but it is cheaper. So I would really recommend that rather than this model. The only reason you would need this version is if you need to perform calculations in front of clients so its a nicer and more professional looking device. I hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was prompt and all in all, I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: I mean if you need a financial calculator go for it. The buttons feel kinda cheap though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, does the job. Case could be nicer.
customer_reviews.text: worked as expected. The only thing of note is the cheap leather cover is very hard to put on and does very little for protection. It is also very easy to turn this on accidentally in your back or pock the power button should be recessed a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: tim nyberg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect calculator and just what I needed for school
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator used, so I got a great deal compared to retail! I am most satisfied with that. But, the calculator itself has been very easy to use. Mind didn't include a manual, but that was easy enough to find with a quick internet search. I believe this calc and the TI BA II Plus are probably the two most commonly used financial calculators. Sure makes home work go a lot faster!
customer_reviews.author: TA.D

customer_reviews.title: defective screen
customer_reviews.text: The unit we received had a defective display that has random black marks that come and go, and are sensitive to a light physical touch on the screen. I saw other buyers reported similar issues. We are returning it. I want to buy one again, but I am not so sure about the quality of the display and whether we may receive another item with the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Berrymom

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new. The screen sometimes has this weird black stuff on the back of it. It appears as though this is due to the fact that the screen itself is a soft, pliable plastic. The keys also stick sometimes, and if you aren’t paying attention, this can mess up your calculations majorly.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to finish my Corporate Finance class!
customer_reviews.author: Christina burzinski

customer_reviews.title: Good functioning professional looking calculator but..
customer_reviews.text: this is a good looking calculator for the desk of an accountant but it comes with a caveat. It's not a solar calculator so it shuts off automatically every few minutes so if you are working on a task and turn to it for a calculation you have to hit the power button to wake it up. It doesn't register rapid key entries all the time so you have to really watch your inputs. And lastly it doesn't have commas in the display so when dealing with large numbers you have to double check your number places. Overall a decent calculator with a few negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Potter

customer_reviews.title: Damaged packaging
customer_reviews.text: The calculator did not seem to be damaged, but the packaging was completely torn up so I returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: Airbornliz

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is perfect for computing all the financial problems you may encounter. There are buttons which make calculating present value and interest rates a breeze. Also, the buttons have a nice feel to them, and the all around design is very eye catching and classy looking. I am very glad I chose this over the opposing (plastic) version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoniast

customer_reviews.title: like the battery was dying
customer_reviews.text: The calculator broke shortly after I got it. I replace the battery assuming that was the main issue. A week or two later the calculator was acting up again, like the battery was dying. Lastly, the day of my last test for the class I bought the calculator for, it died. Replaced the battery, still didn't work. I had to borrow a calculator that day that worked. Other Texas Instruments BA II Plus Professional work fine. Overall, it you are going into a Finance class this calculator will make it easier than the regular plus version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the HP-12c better
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this has everything you want in a convenient package and is easy to use. But it does feel cheap to me. I hate having to use it. I have both this and the HP-12c. I understand why people like this, but I pick up my HP-12c 5 times more than the BA II plus. Once you get used to HP's reverse polish notation, nothing feels as good anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Apollinaire

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I really like this calculator. I am an accounting student and this calculator helps me perform many accounting problems quickly. During my exams it helps to have a calculator which is pre-programmed with many of the necessary ratios. The worksheets are also extremely helpful. The buttons are a little stiff but that is not a con for me. It is also a very beautiful electronic machine. I plan to further my studies in the area of finance and many of the functions support that - it is CFA certified. I just plain and simple love it.
customer_reviews.author: Roland of Gilead

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator, but I got one with problem
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this calculator for CFA exam. It is a great calculator. The reason that I give 3 starts is the time button of the calculator does not work well.
customer_reviews.author: bing

customer_reviews.title: It Adds Up
customer_reviews.text: This low cost calculator fits the bill. I purchased this unit for my daughter for Christmas as she taking accounting classes. It's exactly what she wanted. It performs all of the necessary business functions with power to spare. It is lightweight but durable. The functions are pretty intuitive. And it has the Texas Instrument quality that we have depended on for years. The Amazon price was great as I shopped this calculator around. To add it up, you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Mac

customer_reviews.title: The calculator works great, but some textbook equations that require a financial ...
customer_reviews.text: The calculator works great, but some textbook equations that require a financial calculator have to be entered in a different format than the ones specified in the book, which is is a bit of a hassle - looking up the formats in the calculator directions. Otherwise, I would have given it a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: Hy Tekk

customer_reviews.title: CFA calc
customer_reviews.text: Got this for CFA exam, personally it is better to get the plus pro because of the quick access it provides. Once you get used to it, very easy to use. I would recommend getting it early if you are planning to take the CFA exam.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleyoung

product_meta.title: Texas Instruments BA II Plus Professional Financial Calculator
product_meta.description:
The BA II Plus Professional calculator features all the great features of its predecessor while packing in even more time-saving functions to make short work of complex equations. It's an ideal choice for entry level and advanced finance, accounting, economics, investment, statistics, and other business classes. It's also a great choice to bring to the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) exam. Along with the standard capabilities of time-value-of-money, accrued interest, amortization, cost-sell-margin, and depreciation calculations, users can calculate more advanced business and finance related issues. It will handle net future value (NFV), modified internal rate of return (MIRR), modified duration, payback, discount payback, and more. Its rugged metal exterior, firm-touch keypad and anti-slip rubber feet make it ideal for anyone in accounting, economics, investing, statistics, and related businesses. Note-automatic power down feature turns off the calculator automatically after about five minutes of inactivity, the calculator turns on exactly as left



AMAZON.COM
The BA II Plus Professional calculator features all the great features of its predecessor while packing in even more time-saving functions to make short work of complex equations. It's an ideal choice for entry level and advanced finance, accounting, economics, investment, statistics, and other business classes. It's also a great choice to bring to the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) exam. Along with the standard capabilities of time-value-of-money, accrued interest, amortization, cost-sell-margin, and depreciation calculations, users can calculate more advanced business and finance related issues. It will handle net future value (NFV), modified internal rate of return (MIRR), modified duration, payback, discount payback, and more. Its rugged metal exterior, firm-touch keypad and anti-slip rubber feet make it ideal for anyone in accounting, economics, investing, statistics, and related businesses.
feature_bullets: Solves time-value-of-money calculations such as annuities, mortgages, leases, savings, and more
Performs cash-flow analysis for up to 32 uneven cash flows with up to 4-digit frequencies
Calculates various financial functions: Net Future Value Net present Value Modified Internal Rate of Return Internal Rate of Return Modified Duration Payback Discounted Payback
The Texas Instruments BAII Plus Professional features an Automatic Power Down (APD) function for extended battery life
Prompted display guides you through financial calculations showing current variable and label. Ten-digit display
